excerpts.title: Design without Lorem Ipsum
excerpts.body:
Back in August 2009 I made a vow never to use Lorem Ipsum again!
Partly because I could recite more words of Lorem Ipsum than I could numbers of Pi, but mainly because I noticed it encouraged bad design habits and impeded feedback and discussion in client meetings.
I don’t agree with some of my thoughts from 2009, […]

excerpts.title: G’Day Mate!
excerpts.body:
A wonderful package arrived on my desk this morning!
It contained the CSS Awwwards book from The CSS Awards* honouring the best CSS Websites of 2010 - that’s a lot of CSS!
I’m Mr July 9. It makes me happy but humbled, especially sat next to The Mid-Century Modernist - a site far more worthy of such an accolade.
I […]

excerpts.title: A Month of Interests
excerpts.body:
If you don’t follow my Design Heroes blog these are the links that I’ve found inspiring, useful or just plain funny over the last month!
Foundation
I watch and listen to a lot of podcasts but Foundation by Kevin Rose is one of the more exciting ones to appear recently. It’s all about web start-ups and innovation online. […]

excerpts.title: On doing what you do best
excerpts.body:
Today I’m exceedingly happy :-D
My article Bringing Interactivity To Your Website With Web Standards has just been published on Smashing Magazine, the biggest web design blog there is. I’m also half way through writing my second article. (Despite being immensely tired from slogging out up to 14 hours of work daily over the last fortnight – ouch!)
I […]

excerpts.title: Reflecting on Aesthetics
excerpts.body:
This past month I’ve focused solely on the accessibility and usability of web design. I’ve spent a long time considering how this fits into my daily practice, for real clients and personal projects, and all the ideals, limitations and opportunities involved.
In my article Transitioning as a Web Designer I sum up a very practical evolution […]

excerpts.title: Transitioning as a Web Designer
excerpts.body:
“Web Designer” is one of the most exciting job titles in the design category. That’s because — and bear with me here — what was once an acceptable website design in a particular year may no longer be acceptable to produce the next.
For the last couple of years at Base Creative I’ve been designing fixed-width […]

excerpts.title: Happy New Ye…oh
excerpts.body:
Ah, it’s the 9th already?
I don’t do New Year’s resolutions, but I do like to look forward every now and then to consider all the amazing opportunities out there. 2011 is going to be all about pushing boundaries in life and work.
(Not sure what that means in reality but I’ve plenty of time to find […]
